body_text:
Reactify basic CRUD for control admin.
Cleaned up and squashed some commits, so hopefully this is a little easier to stomach.  Cut out some extraneous commits and filed bugs for remaining work:
1271272 - Build route & actions for handling recipe history
1271274 - Validate recipe edit forms
1271276 - Handle API request failures in UI
1271278 - Add eslint to normandy for control admin
1271279 - Test react components
1266483 - Generate action configuration forms for arguments_json field
Notable brokenness is on adding a recipe, the action form isn't in there yet so our request is failing with missing fields. Adding the action forms requires a bit of refactoring and a decent amount of additional code, so I want to put those in a follow-up PR.

Notable brokenness is on adding a recipe, the action form isn't in there yet so our request is failing with missing fields. Adding the action forms requires a bit of refactoring and a decent amount of additional code, so I want to put those in a follow-up PR.
title: Reactify and webpackify control admin
body:
Reactify basic CRUD for control admin.

Cleaned up and squashed some commits, so hopefully this is a little easier to stomach.  Cut out some extraneous commits and filed bugs for remaining work:

[1271272](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271272) - Build route & actions for handling recipe history
[1271274](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271274) - Validate recipe edit forms
[1271276](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271276) - Handle API request failures in UI
[1271278](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271278) - Add eslint to normandy for control admin
[1271279](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1271279) - Test react components
[1266483](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1266483) - Generate action configuration forms for arguments_json field

Notable brokenness is on adding a recipe, the action form isn't in there yet so our request is failing with missing fields. Adding the action forms requires a bit of refactoring and a decent amount of additional code, so I want to put those in a follow-up PR.
